raw_text:
The gaming world in 2005
 
 If you have finished Doom 3, Half Life 2 and Halo 2, don't worry. There's a host of gaming gems set for release in 2005.
 
  WORLD OF WARCRAFT 
 
 The US reception to this game from developers Blizzard has been hugely enthusiastic, with the title topping its competitors in the area of life-eating, high-fantasy, massively multiplayer role-player gaming. Solid, diverse, accessible and visually striking, it may well open up the genre like never before. If nothing else, it will develop a vast and loyal community. Released 25 February on PC. ICO 2 (WORKING TITLE) Ico remains a benchmark for PS2 gaming, a title that took players into a uniquely atmospheric and artistic world of adventure. The (spiritual) sequel has visuals that echo those of the original, but promises to expand the Ico world, with hero Wanda taking on a series of giants. The other known working title is Wanda And Colossus. Release date to be confirmed on PS2. THE LEGEND OF ZELDA 
 
 The charismatic cel imagery has been scrapped in favour of a dark, detailed aesthetic (realism isn't quite the right word) that connects more with Ocarina Of Time. Link resumes his more teenage incarnation too, though enemies, elements and moves look familiar from the impressive trailer that has been released. Horseback adventuring across a vast land is promised. Release date to be confirmed on GameCube. ADVANCE WARS DS The UK Nintendo DS launch line-up is still to be confirmed at time of writing, but titles that exploit its two-screen and touch capacity, like WarioWare Touched! and Sega's Feel The Magic, are making a strong impression in other territories. Personally, I can't wait for the latest Advance Wars, the franchise that has been the icing on the cake of Nintendo handheld gaming during the past few years. Release date to be confirmed on DS. S.T.A.L.K.E.R. 
 
 Following in the high-spec footsteps of Far Cry and Half-Life 2, this looks like the key upcoming PC first-person shooter (with role-playing elements). The fact that it is inspired in part by Andrei Tarkovsky's enigmatic 1979 masterpiece Stalker and set in 2012 in the disaster zone, a world of decay and mutation, makes it all the more intriguing. Released 1 March on PC. METAL GEAR SOLID: SNAKE EATER 
 
 More Hideo Kojima serious stealth, featuring action in the Soviet-controlled jungle in 1964. The game see Snake having to survive on his wits in the jungle, including eating wildlife. Once again, expect cinematic cut scenes and polished production values. Released March on PS2. DEAD OR ALIVE ULTIMATE Tecmo's Team Ninja are back with retooled and revamped versions of Dead Or Alive 1 and 2. Here's the big, big deal though - they're playable over Xbox Live. Released 11 March on Xbox. KNIGHTS OF THE OLD REPUBLIC II Looks set to build on the acclaimed original Star Wars role playing game with new characters, new Force powers and a new set of moral decisions, despite a different developer. Released 11 February on Xbox and PC.
llama3.2:1b:
Here is a summary of the text in plain text:

The gaming world in 2005 included:

- World of Warcraft: released on PC
- Ico (also known as ICO 2): released on PS2 with visuals that echo those of the original, but promising expansion to the game world
- The Legend of Zelda: release date confirmed for GameCube
- Advance Wars DS: announced with titles like WarioWare Touched!

and Feel The Magic, which are making a strong impression in other territories
- S.T.A.L.K.E.R.

: released on PC
- Metal Gear Solid 2: Snake Eater: released on PS2 with cinematic cut scenes and polished production values
- Dead Or Alive Ultimate: retooled and revamped versions of the game on Xbox Live for both console platforms
- Knights of the Old Republic II: released on Xbox and PC
llama3.2:3b: World of Warcraft is expected to release in 2005, topping its competitors in life-eating, high-fantasy, massively multiplayer role-player gaming.
Ico 2 has visuals that echo the original but promises to expand the world, with a release date confirmed for PS2.
The Legend of Zelda has been revamped with a dark aesthetic and will feature horseback adventuring across a vast land on GameCube.
Advance Wars DS is set to be released on the Nintendo DS, while S.T.A.L.K.E.R.
follows in the high-spec footsteps of Far Cry and Half-Life 2, releasing on PC on March 1.
Metal Gear Solid: Snake Eater features stealth action in a Soviet-controlled jungle on PS2, and Dead or Alive Ultimate will be playable over Xbox Live with a release date confirmed for March 11.
gemma2:2b: In 2005, major releases include World of Warcraft, Ico 2, The Legend of Zelda, Advance Wars DS, S.T.A.L.K.E.R., Metal Gear Solid: Snake Eater, Dead or Alive Ultimate, Knights of the Old Republic II.
qwen2.5:0.5b: 2005 is anticipated to see significant gaming developments.
The US has shown enthusiastic reception for the games World of Warcraft, World of WARCRAFT, and WORLD OF SWORDS SOLID: SNAKE EATER.
World of Warcraft is set for release in 2005.
World of WARCRAFT, World of WARS, and World of SWORDS SOLIDE have working titles, and some are currently confirmed to be released in early 2005 on different platforms.
The games aim to develop a vast community devoted to them and continue the trend of PC gaming.
qwen2.5:1.5b: 2005 gaming gems include World of Warcraft, The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time II, Advance Wars DS, S.T.A.L.K.E.R., Metal Gear Solid: Snake Eater, Dead or Alive Ultimate, Knights of the Old Republic II, and more.
qwen2.5:3b: In 2005, notable gaming releases included World of Warcraft, which tops competitors in massively multiplayer online role-playing games; Ico (working title Wanda And Colossus), a sequel to the visually striking game Ico; The Legend of Zelda with a darker aesthetic; Advance Wars DS, an enhanced version of the popular handheld series; S.T.A.L.K.E.R., inspired by Andrei Tarkovsky's Stalker and set in a post-apocalyptic world; Metal Gear Solid: Snake Eater, another stealth action game featuring cinematic cutscenes; Dead or Alive Ultimate, a reworked version with online multiplayer for Xbox; and Knights of the Old Republic II, an enhanced sequel to the original.
opencoder:1.5b: The gaming world in 2005.
WORLD OF WARCRAFT (GAME TITLE) is being announced by renowned publisher Electronic Arts, marking the onset of an exciting new gaming era.
The title boasts intense multiplayer action, offering players a thrilling narrative driven by realism and strategy.
The game features a compelling storyline with its own characters, elements, and mechanics that challenge players to battle through various challenges.

The following are key highlights:

1.
Developed by renowned game developer Blizzard Entertainment.
Features diverse gameplay mechanics, including a focus on balance and strategy.
A visually stunning, high-definition 3D environment with rich sci-fi theme.
An in-depth storyline featuring epic boss battles and character development.
Released at various platforms, with PC and PS2 as prime targets.
In the realm of gaming, WORLD OF WARCRAFT promises to continue its loyal players' fan base.

The upcoming sequel will add a level of depth to the world, with characters revolving around iconic iconic tales from the original games like Wanda and Colossus, and expand upon these iconic heroes' abilities to outdo their adversaries.
This is a game that not only challenges but also expands into new dimensions of strategy and adventure.
The sequel's visuals will echo those of the original, with enhanced character designs and more fluid combat animations to keep up with the dramatic world narrative.
It's set on a vast and enigmatic land, with elements and mechanics reminiscent of the original games' counterparts.
The game also introduces new modes, such as horseback riding across realms, and elements that are familiar from the iconic video game series like Ocarina of Time.
With more gameplay mechanics and more unique storyline twists, WORLD OF WARCRAFT is set to remain a favorite among fans for its engaging and thrilling gameplay.

More exciting comes with upcoming titles like Advance Wars, the franchise renowned for its intense multiplayer shooter and massively multiplayer action games, and S.T.A.L.K.E.R., one of the best-selling epic FPS titles ever.
The UK Nintendo DS launch line-up will be confirmed at time of writing.
The release date of various games such as S.T.A.L.K.E.R.
is also being confirmed on GameCube, but the timeline for World Of Warcraft and other upcoming titles is still largely uncertain.
smollm:1.7b: The gaming world in 2005 was abuzz with excitement as several high-profile titles were announced for release in the coming year.

Here's a summary of the key events:

**World of WarCraft**: The US reception to this game from developers Blizzard has been hugely enthusiastic, with the title topping its competitors in the area of life-eating, high-fantasy, massively multiplayer role-playing gaming (MMORPG).
Solid, diverse, accessible and visually striking, it may well open up the genre like never before.
If nothing else, it will develop a vast and loyal community.
Released 25 February on PC.

**World of WarCraft: The Legacy**: This sequel promises to expand the Warcraft universe with new heroes, elements, and moves, while maintaining the same high-fantasy setting and gameplay as its predecessor.
Release date to be confirmed on PC.
**The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild**: Link's return in this game marks a significant departure from his previous games, with a focus on exploration and discovery rather than combat.
The game promises to push the boundaries of open-world gaming, with an emphasis on storytelling and character development.
Released 25 February on PS2.
**Advance Wars: The Legend**: This title is set in the same universe as Advance Wars, but takes place in a different time period - 1964.
It promises to explore new gameplay mechanics and features, while still maintaining the same high-fantasy setting and atmosphere as its predecessors.
Release date to be confirmed on PS2.
**S.T.A.L.K.E.R.
: The Legend**: This game is set in a similar universe to S.T.A.L.K.E.R., but with a focus on stealth gameplay and exploration rather than action-based combat.
It promises to offer a new take on the classic S.T.A.L.K.E.R.
formula, while still maintaining the same high-fantasy setting and atmosphere as its predecessors.
Release date to be confirmed on PS2.
**Metal Gear Solid: The Legend**: This game is set in the same universe as Metal Gear Solid, but with a focus on stealth gameplay and exploration rather than action-based combat.
It promises to offer a new take on the classic Metal Gear formula, while still maintaining the same high-fantasy setting and atmosphere as its predecessors.
Release date to be confirmed on PS2.
**Metal Gear Solid: The Legacy**: This sequel promises to build upon the success of Metal Gear Solid, with a focus on exploration and discovery rather than combat.
It also promises to offer new gameplay mechanics and features, while still maintaining the same high-fantasy setting and atmosphere as its predecessors.
Release date to be confirmed on PS2.
**Kojima's Team Ninja**: This game is set in a similar universe to Metal Gear Solid, but with a focus on stealth gameplay and exploration rather than action-based combat.
It promises to offer a new take on the classic Metal Gear formula, while still maintaining the same high-fantasy setting and atmosphere as its predecessors.
Release date to be confirmed on Xbox.
**Dead Or Alive ULTIMATE Tecmo's Team Ninja**: This game is set in a similar universe to Metal Gear Solid, but with a focus on stealth gameplay and exploration rather than action-based combat.
It promises to offer a new take on the classic Metal Gear formula, while still maintaining the same high-fantasy setting and atmosphere as its predecessors.
Release date to be confirmed on Xbox.

deepseek-r1:1.5b: The gaming world in 2005 saw the availability of free releases for several titles: Doom 3, Half Life 2, and Halo 2.
World of Warcraft received mixed reception from Blizzard, which described it as a vibrant, immersive experience with solid visuals and a growing community.
Legend of Zelka on PS2 introduced a visually stunning game with elements from Ocarina Of Time and promises for future expansion.
Advance Wars DS for Nintendo was confirmed to be launched in April, focusing on the iconic series.
on PC featured new stealth mechanics inspired by Andrei Tarkovsky's game, with a release date yet to be determined.
Metal Gear Solid: Snake Eater introduced on PC built on Far Cry 3, emphasizing stealth and role-playing elements.
Dead or Alive ULTIMATE was released on Xbox Live over Treo, reimagining the original series.
Knights of the Old Republic II will follow on Xbox and PC.

phi:2.7b: In 2005, several gaming gems were released, including World of Warcraft, The Legend of Zelda, Advance Wars DS, S.T.A.L.K.E.R., Metal Gear Solid 4, Dead or Alive Ultimate, and Knights of the Old Republic II.

World of Warcraft is a high-fantasy massively multiplayer role-player game that has received enthusiastic reception from developers, with solid graphics, diverse gameplay, and an accessible and visually striking design.
The Legend of Zelda: Ico is praised for its unique and atmospheric world, while The Legend of Zelda: Z Zelda expands upon the original's themes and introduces a new hero.
Metal Gear Solid 4 offers improved production values and cinematic cutscenes, while S.T.A.L.K.E.R.
takes place in a decaying world inspired by Andrei Tarkovsky's Stalker.

Dead or Alive Ultimate is a team-based fighting game with online play, while Knights of the Old Republic II continues the story set in the Star Wars universe and offers new Force powers and moral decisions for players to make.

chatgpt-4o-latest: The gaming world in 2005 featured several highly anticipated releases.
"World of Warcraft" from Blizzard was praised for its accessibility and immersive multiplayer experience, launching on February 25 for PC.
A spiritual sequel to "Ico," tentatively titled "ICO 2" or "Wanda and Colossus," aimed to expand its atmospheric world on PS2.
"The Legend of Zelda" for GameCube abandoned cel-shading for a darker aesthetic, promising horseback exploration.
"Advance Wars DS" was a highly awaited strategy game for the Nintendo DS.
"S.T.A.L.K.E.R.," inspired by Tarkovsky’s film, was a post-apocalyptic first-person shooter set for a March 1 release on PC.
"Metal Gear Solid: Snake Eater" brought stealth action to the Soviet jungle in 1964, launching in March for PS2.
"Dead or Alive Ultimate" revamped the first two games with Xbox Live support, releasing on March 11.
"Knights of the Old Republic II" expanded the Star Wars RPG experience with new characters and choices, launching on February 11 for Xbox and PC.

granite3.1-dense:2b:
In 2005, anticipated video games included:

- World of Warcraft (Blizzard) - A massively multiplayer role-playing game that could expand the genre with its enthusiastic reception and diverse, accessible gameplay set in a high-fantasy world.

- Ico 2/Wanda And Colossus (Not confirmed for platform) - A sequel to the critically acclaimed PS2 adventure game Ico, promising an expansive world and new challenges for the hero Wanda against giant foes.
- The Legend of Zelda - A return to Link's teenage form with a darker, realistic style inspired by Ocarina of Time, featuring horseback adventures across a vast land.
Release date: To be confirmed on GameCube.
- Advance Wars DS (Not confirmed for platform) - The latest installment in the popular Nintendo DS strategy franchise that utilizes both screens and touch capabilities effectively.
Expected release: To be confirmed on DS.
: Shadow of Chernobyl - A first-person shooter with role-playing elements set in 2012's decaying disaster zone, influenced by Andrei Tarkovsky's Stalker.

- Metal Gear Solid: Snake Eater - Hideo Kojima's return to stealth action, featuring a survivalist experience in the Soviet-controlled jungle of 1964 with wildlife consumption for sustenance and cinematic cut scenes.
- Dead or Alive Ultimate - Tecmo's Team Ninja retooled versions of Dead or Alive 1 & 2, playable over Xbox Live.
- Knights of the Old Republic II - A sequel to the acclaimed Star Wars role-playing game, introducing new characters, Force powers, and moral choices, despite a different developer.
Release date: 11 February on Xbox and PC.
